page.title: 06Highways & byeways of Laggan
page.content: The A86 from Newtonmore to Fort William passes over the river Spey at Laggan bridge.This road west has now passed over 4 bridges at Laggan since 1815.The most recent bridge was built by Morrison Construction of Tain and was funded partly by European aid. The 4 bridges have been constructed in stone/wood/steel and concrete and steel.Just beyond the bridge the now tarred road but previous track A889 from Dalwhinnie meets A86.From the village centre an unclassified road known to locals as"The Glen Road"also leads to the General Wade's bridge at Garva and military road to Fort Augustus.This 18th century road is still passable by 4wd vehicles-Laggan Youth Club completed it in 1984 on foot with Land Rover backup. Height at summit 830m/2507ft.
